definition: to kneel down/to sink to one's knees/to grovel
to kneel
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: He should kneel down in front of the whole family and keep confessing for the rest of his life.
sentences.chinese: 这样的医生，应当跪倒在遇害家人面前，忏悔终生。

sentences.english: Suddenly Wester rose from his seat, circled the table and dropped to his knees by Shaun's side.
sentences.chinese: 突然韦斯特站起来，绕过桌子，跪倒在肖恩的身边。

sentences.english: That is, until humanity kneels before my army of cyborg clones.
sentences.chinese: 直到人类军队跪倒在我的电子机械克隆人大军面前。

sentences.english: I fall to my knees, I cry and I cry.
sentences.chinese: 双膝跪倒的偶，疾苦流涕。

sentences.english: Then the master stumbled out of the door of the cottage and fell to his knees, weeping helplessly.
sentences.chinese: 然后他跌跌撞撞地走出农舍，跪倒在地，放声大哭。

sentences.english: Norm takes a few steps and drops to his knees. Imploded by grief.
sentences.chinese: 诺姆无力地走了几步，然后跪倒在地，悲痛欲绝。

sentences.english: I fell on my knees and looked at him.
The young man released his grip on the gun, fell to his knees and began to cry.
sentences.chinese: 那少年郎放开了枪，跪倒地上，哭将起来。

sentences.english: The girl threw herself on her knees before him, and took his gray head in her arms.
sentences.chinese: 女孩扑下跪倒在他跟前，把他灰白的脑袋搂入怀里。

sentences.english: Lincoln painfully drops to his knees and the police restrain him.
sentences.chinese: Lincoln痛苦地跪倒在地，警员铐住了他。

sentences.english: The father falls to his knees and tearfully thanks God.
sentences.chinese: 父亲跪倒在地，热泪盈眶地感谢上帝。

definition: to kneel down
to crouch (of animal)
to kneel
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
lit. to kowtow like grinding garlic (idiom)/fig. to pound the ground with one's head
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
(onom.) sound of object falling into water/plop
to kowtow/to kneel and worship
both knees
to kowtow in salute
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to bow
to salute/to greet
to salute/to make one's salutations
to prostrate oneself/to fall on one's knees/to grovel
